conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows (A, B, C, and D) change when the light source moves directly above the objects.
The initial scene shows four objects above the slabs, which are illuminated by a light source casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
The shadows (A, B, C, and D) are cast to the left of the objects, indicating the light source is positioned to the right of the objects.

premise: The light source moves to the right and directly above the objects.
conclusion: The direction and angle of the light change.

premise: The light source is directly above the objects.
Shadows are cast downward due to the light source being directly above.
conclusion: The length and direction of the shadows change.

premise: The light source is directly above the objects.
conclusion: The shadows shift directly underneath the objects.

premise: The light source is directly above the objects.
conclusion: The shadows become shorter because the angle at which the light hits the objects is reduced.

premise: Shadow A is cast by the ball.
conclusion: Shadow A moves directly under the ball and shortens.

premise: Shadow B is cast by the blue object.
conclusion: Shadow B moves directly under the blue object and shortens.

premise: Shadow D is cast by the other side of the blue object.

premise: All shadows shift directly underneath their respective objects and become shorter.
conclusion: When the light source moves to the right and directly above the objects, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift directly underneath the objects and become shorter.
